You'll also get a Christmas offering from Heart

Pink Floyd, CCR among this week's new releases

Jeffrey Lee Puckett, jpuckett@courier-journal.com 8:15 a.m. EST November 10, 2014

Pink Floyd, "Endless River."(Photo: Promotional photo)

CONNECT 3 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE


Pop/rock — The New Basement Tapes is James, Elvis Costello, Marcus Mumford, the Carolina Chocolate Drops' Rhiannon Giddens and Taylor Goldsmith of Dawes. They took a stack of unused Bob Dylan lyrics and set them to music, creating "Lost On the River: The New Basement Tapes." The lyrics were written by Dylan in 1967, while he was hanging out in Woodstock and rolling tape with The Band.

Pink Floyd's "The Endless River" finds David Gilmour and Nick Mason building songs around keyboard parts left behind by the late Richard Wright after wrapping up the recording sessions for 1994's "The Division Bell." It's an instrumental album with one new lyric song.

Röyksopp is calling it quits with "The Inevitable End," on which it collaborates with muse Robyn; Bryan Ferry's "Avonmore" features guests such as Ronnie Spector, Johnny Marr, Flea and Nile Rodgers.

COURIER-JOURNAL

Foo Fighters take the 'Sonic Highway'

… And You Will Know Us By the Trail of Dead can claim a few hyphens, notably post-prog and post-hardcore, and "IX" is rumored to be a sequel to 2011's "Tao of the Dead"; Nick Jonas can claim zero hyphens for "Nick Jonas."

Damien Rice has been far too sad to make a record. He has been sad for eight years. Have you ever seen this guy in concert? He's very sad. "My Favourite Faded Fantasy" is the Irish singer's third album.

The Jazz June, "After the Earthquake"; Job for a Cowboy, "Sun Eater"; Machine Head, "Bloodstone & Diamonds"; King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard, "I'm in Your Mind Fuzz."

Saving Abel, "Blood Stained Revolution"; The Birthday Massacre, "Superstition"; Knife Party, "Abandon Ship"; Celestial Shore, "Enter Ghost"; Dream Police, "Hypnotized."

Creedence Clearwater Revival's entire catalog is being packaged as a vinyl-only box set, "The Complete Studio Albums," which is part of a Fantasy Records label-wide reissue project; "Sun Zoom Spark: 1970 to 1972" is a Captain Beefheart box set with four discs; Status Quo, "Aquostic (Stripped Bare)" is an acoustic album with spelling issues.

Garth Brooks, "Man Against Machine."(Photo: Promotional photo)

Country/bluegrass — Garth Brooks used to be a terror. Dude ruled all of popular music with an iron fist and, once, an elaborate codpiece. He's been in semi-retirement for 13 years while his kids grew up and is now attempting a comeback with "Man Against Machine," an album that denounces Twitter and Facebook. Has he even been paying attention?

Christmas — Heart, "Heart & Friends: Home for the Holidays"; various artists, including cast members, give us "Christmas at Downton Abbey"; still more various artists, such as KT Tunstall, contribute to the soundtrack for "Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever," a new holiday TV special; Irvin Mayfield & The New Orleans Jazz Playhouse Revue, "A New Orleans Creole Christmas."

Jeffrey Lee Puckett can be reached at (502) 582-4160, jpuckett@courier-journal.com and on Twitter, @JLeePuckett.
